location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter C from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Hennell reports on his visit to Muscat where he met His Highness the Imam of Muscat, accompanied by Major Atkins Hamerton, Her Majesty's Consul and the Honourable Company's Agent in the dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muscat, and Captain Arnold Kemball, who is due to take over Hennell's duties as Resident in the Persian Gulf. Hennell states that the meeting with the Imam was cordial, and that public matters were not touched upon, with the exception of the Imam stating that he expected the imminent return of son Syed Thoweynee with Sheikh Mukhtoom [Maktum] from Sohar [Suhar], which they were to take possession of.
